children.subject: This is not sufficient. Last year we were required to obtain a letter with the name of a class with in-person components explicitly mentioned.

history.content:
I'm not sure if asking this on here is the best idea or if I should just wait for my class Piazzas to open, but I feel like it is worth bringing this to the attention of all classes.

International students who enter the country this academic year that started school during the pandemic (i.e. first- and second-years; I'm not too sure if new transfers are also subject) will require proof that their program of study was not "100% online." This proof will have to be in the form of a letter signed by an instructor that states that we took their class with an in-person component.

Given that most EE/CS classes will have in-person discussion sections, which is sufficient for satisfying the requirements, do they have plans to support distributing these letters to students who need it, including myself?
history.subject: Plans to support students who need proof of in-person instruction
